item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Saturday, October 12, 2024 at 12:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Every bug/quirk of the Windows resource compiler (rc.exe), probably (31 points | 9 comments)
2. LLMs don’t do formal reasoning - and that is a HUGE problem (11 points | 2 comments)
3. A Dictionary of Single-Letter Variable Names (11 points | no comments)
4. The Ultimate Conditional Syntax (19 points | 2 comments)
5. Adapting Plan 9's listen to GNU Guix (17 points | 13 comments)
6. Idol, an IDL and binary encoding for zero-copy local IPC (20 points | 14 comments)
7. A history of Clojure (2020) (3 points | 1 comment)
8. FFI type mismatches in Rust for Linux (10 points | 2 comments)
9. AMD EPYC 9965 "Turin Dense” vs. AmpereOne 192-Core ARM CPU Review (14 points | 3 comments)
10. uLisp - A Lisp compiler to RISC-V written in Lisp (18 points | 2 comments)
11. AAA gaming on Asahi Linux (139 points | 29 comments)
12. Tutorial on Good Lisp Programming Style (1993) (10 points | 4 comments)
13. Deploying a Single-Binary Haskell Web App (13 points | 7 comments)
14. A Small Experiment in Async Rust (1 points | no comments)
15. Request for developer feedback: customizable select (7 points | 1 comment)
16. The Copenhagen Book: General Guideline on Implementing Auth in Web Applications (15 points | 2 comments)
17. Perks of Being a Python Core Developer (7 points | no comments)
18. Packaging an Elixir/Phoenix application with Nix (8 points | no comments)
19. cizzbuzz: An exploration of GitHub Merge Queues (3 points | no comments)
20. oss-fuzz-gen: LLM powered fuzzing via OSS-Fuzz (1 points | no comments)
21. What is Sync? (7 points | no comments)
22. Interneting Is Hard (14 points | 2 comments)
23. What are you doing this weekend? (8 points | 17 comments)
24. It's Not Easy Being Green: On the Energy Efficiency of Programming Languages (38 points | 38 comments)
25. Writing the Worst Datalog Ever in 26loc (5 points | no comments)
